page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: This 12 sq.km. area lies east of Biggleswade encompssing the commuter village of Dunton. Present day Dunton has developed around a 12th century agricultural base and church. It consists mainly of new residential developments. Land use throughout the area is dominated by arable farming. There are five farms in the area each averaging 200 acres. The area includes the most southerly fringe of Biggleswade which is composed of an industrial estate and residential housing. Several schools are within the area, one being a special school for less academically able children. There is also a hospital of late Victorian age present in the north of the area.
